meanings.definition: To crawl out from a place.
meanings.sent1: The tiny bug outcrawls from under the rock.
meanings.sent2: The baby slowly outcrawls from the blanket.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky spider outcrawls from its hiding spot to surprise its prey.
meanings.sent4: The determined ant outcrawls its competitors to reach the food first.
meanings.sent5: The adventurous caterpillar outcrawls its siblings to explore the garden.

meanings.sent1: The energetic puppy outcrawls the older dog in the race.
meanings.sent2: The determined toddler outcrawls the others to reach the toy first.
meanings.sent3: The competitive snail outcrawls its friends in the slow race.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious spider outcrawls its siblings to build the biggest web.
meanings.sent5: The persistent caterpillar outcrawls the obstacles to become a butterfly.
